title: Three arrested after juvenile injured in Saline County shooting
content:
SALINE COUNTY (KATV) —
The Saline County Sheriff's Office arrested three people in connection with a shooting that sent juvenile to the hospital.
Geraldine Clements, Zachary Mitchell, and Season Robinson face charges for a shooting on Sunday, November 27.
Deputies were called out to the 8100 block of Russwood Lane West in Mabelvale, about a shooting just before 8 p.m.
Responding deputies couldn't determine if anyone was injured at the scene, but following an investigation, were able to find that at least one victim was treated at a local hospital.
Mitchell faces numerous charges, including: two counts of criminal attempt to commit capital murder, possession of a firearm by certain person, aggravated assault on a family members, first degree criminal mischief, possession of controlled substance, two counts of possession of drug paraphernalia, and disorderly conduct.
Clements faces charges of hindering an apprehension and tampering with physical evidence, while Robinson was charged with possession of controlled substance and two counts of possession of drug paraphernalia.
